business.headline: Infosys Q4 results: Profit drops 12%, final dividend set at Rs 22The IT major clocked revenue of Rs 40,925 crore for the March quarter, up 8% from Rs 37,923 crore a year ago. In constant currency terms, revenue grew 4.8% YoY but declined 3.5% sequentially.

No public listing in 2 months: Where have IPOs disappeared?Just nine companies have listed on the mainboard till April this year, compared to 25 in the same period last year, and most didn't even leave a mark.
Sensex, Nifty rebound to end nearly 2% higher as banking stocks rallyThe S&P BSE Sensex ended 1508.91 higher at 78,553.20, while the NSE Nifty50 settled 414.45 points higher at 23,851.65.
Sunscreen faceoff: Honasa vs HUL in court over ad claimsThe core of the argument is SPF, the sun protection factor which measures how well a sunscreen protects against harmful UV rays.

Flipkart ends WFH policy, asks all employees to work from office: ReportFlipkart had initially offered flexibility to employees during the pandemic. But over the past year, the company began rolling back the policy in phases—first calling senior executives back to office. Now, the mandate applies to all employees, regardless of role or function.

Vijay Kedia warns of 10 red flags to spot a potential scam amid Gensol fraudInvestor and market expert Vijay Kedia has warned that Gensol is not the only company with problems amid the findings by Sebi.

Rs 25 lakh in India or $100K in US? Bengaluru techie weighs in on what's betterChoosing to stay in India means staying close to family, celebrating festivals, and living within a culture you know well, said the tech professional.

PhonePe rolls out UPI Circle, simplifies payments for family and friendsUPI Circle is a feature by NPCI (National Payments Corporation of India) where a primary user gives permission to a secondary user to make payments from their UPI account, within set limits.

Sebi's job is to find and punish them: Tuhin Kanta Pandey on Gensol fraudThe Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) released an interim order on April 15, stating that Gensol Engineering's promoters, brothers Anmol and Puneet Singh Jaggi, had diverted company funds for personal use.

Surprise rally lights up Dalal Street, Sensex jumps 1,500 points. Here's whyShare market today: Despite a slight uptick in volatility, sentiment turned decisively positive as fears around global trade tensions began to fade. Broader market indices joined the rally, reflecting widespread optimism among investors.

End of the road for BluSmart as Sebi exposes Gensol fraudMany users across Delhi-NCR, Bengaluru, and Mumbai reported that they could no longer book rides through the BluSmart app. The company also sent a notification to users stating that bookings were being temporarily closed.

Infosys Q4 results today: All eyes on FY26 outlook, dividend detailsInfosys Q4FY25 results: As the second-largest software services exporter gears up to release its earnings, investors will be watching closely for guidance on FY26 revenue growth, margins, and management's take on business sentiment in key markets.

entertainment.headline: The Life of Chuck trailer: Tom Hiddleston to headline this Stephen King adaptationNeon has unveiled the trailer for 'The Life of Chuck', a film adaptation of Stephen King's novella. Directed by Mike Flanagan, the movie stars Tom Hiddleston and is set for a June 6 release.

Actor Lakshmi Manchu's Instagram, phone number compromised, calls it scaryLakshmi Manchu's Instagram account was hacked, prompting the actor to respond with a quirky message. She assured fans that if she needed money, she'd ask directly, adding her signature humour to the situation.

Eijaz Khan, Pavitra Punia reunite for short film after breakup. Details hereActors Eijaz Khan and Pavitra Punia have reunited for a project after their breakup. Producer Dalljiet Kaur shares insights on their collaboration.

Ben Affleck on Jon Bernthal's The Punisher: I wouldn't tangle with himBen Affleck praises Jon Bernthal's intense take on The Punisher in Daredevil: Born Again, saying he "wouldn't tangle with him." While reflecting on Marvel's evolution, Affleck shares excitement for The Accountant 2 and his admiration for the darker tone Bernthal brings to Frank Castle.

Kian's Bizarre B&B review: Bigg Boss meets backpacker hostel in this BTS' Jin showReleased-Tue Apr 08, 2025Kian's Bizarre B&B is an eccentric reality show blending quirky humour and heartwarming moments, as BTS's Jin and actor Ji Ye-eun join host Kian84 in a makeshift guesthouse. The show offers a light-hearted, less dramatic alternative to Bigg Boss, with bizarre challenges and unexpected Indian references.

Caste, cinema and uncomfortable truths: Phule's delayed release journey explainedWhy has a film about India's two revolutionary thinkers upset the self-proclaimed caretakers of the Brahmin community? Did the caste-discrimination that Savitribai Phule and Jyotiba Phule fought against not exist in India? Is the country free from caste-based prejudices today?
Karan Johar reveals secret behind his weight loss, and it's not OzempicKaran Johar recently broke his silence over his drastic weight loss. The actor shared his secret behind the transformation.

Demi Moore finally breaks silence on losing Oscar to Anora star Mikey MadisonDemi Moore, 'The Substance' actor, revealed how she felt after losing the Oscar for Best Actress to Mikey Madison. Mikey bagged the award for her performance in the film 'Anora'.

Hailee Steinfeld: I was a crybaby on last day of shoot | ExclusiveHailee Steinfeld reflects on her emotional last day on the set of Ryan Coogler's upcoming vampire thriller 'Sinners', where she plays the role of Mary alongside Michael B Jordan. The film, which explores complex character dynamics and personal histories, is set to release in India on April 18.

Parvathy to Samantha, celebs wish Nazriya Nazim healing after emotional postAfter Nazriya Nazim shared a post explaining her social media absence, she received a lot of love from her industry colleagues and fans. Samantha, Parvathy, Tovino Thomas and several others wished her speedy recovery and healing.

YouTuber claims 'fake paneer served' at Gauri Khan's Torii, restaurant reactsA popular YouTuber alleged the use of fake paneer at Gauri Khan's high-end restaurant, Torii. The establishment addressed the claims and issued a response.

Mimi changed a lot of things for me, it got me more work, says Sai TamhankarSai Tamhankar credits her performance in the film 'Mimi' as a significant career milestone, opening new professional and personal opportunities. The actor shares her journey of evolving through diverse roles and the impact of receiving appreciation for her work.

WAVES Summit 2025: Cultivating next-gen filmmaking talent in IndiaWAVES Summit 2025, organised by FICCI and the Ministry of Information & Broadcasting, is set to revolutionise the media and entertainment industry. The event promises to be a landmark for aspiring filmmakers and storytellers.
Jaat 2 announced: Sunny Deol reunites with director Gopichand MalineniAfter its successful run, Sunny Deol announced 'Jaat 2'. The actor will be seen reprising his role as Baldev Pratap Singh.

Varun Grover's witty take on Kunal Kamra row, adds funny disclaimer to new videoComedian Varun Grover humorously addressed the controversy surrounding fellow comedian Kunal Kamra during a recent performance. Kamra faced backlash from Shiv Sena for his parody song mocking Maharashtra's deputy CM Eknath Shinde.

Good Bad Ugly box office Day 7: Ajith's film gets strong push ahead of 2nd weekendAjith's film 'Good Bad Ugly' is doing good business at the box office, both domestically and worldwide. The film has already emerged as the top Tamil grosser of the year so far, and is only the second film on Ajith's resume in the global Rs 200 crore club.

Malayalam actor Vincy accuses Shine Tom Chacko of drug abuse, misconductMalayalam actor Vincy Aloshious filed a complaint against Shine Tom Chacko with the Kerala Film Chamber of Commerce. She had earlier accused her co-star of using drugs on set and misbehaving with her.

The Royals: Ishaan Khatter, Bhumi Pednekar's coming-of-age drama to release in MayIshaan Khatter and Bhumi Pednekar's upcoming series, 'The Royals', is set to premiere on Netflix on May 9. The makers announced the date with a poster.

Logout review: Babil Khan gets likes, followers and chaos in tech thrillerReleased-Fri Apr 18, 2025Babil Khan's 'Logout' will stream on Zee5 from April 18 onwards. The thriller offers a chilling commentary on digital obsession and the following psychological unraveling. Read our review.

general news.headline: You can't direct the President: Vice President's swipe at judiciary after key orderVice President Jagdeep Dhankhar expressed alarm at the judiciary stepping into roles reserved for the Executive and Legislature.

Illegal occupation: India slams Pak Army's 'Kashmir our jugular vein' commentPakistan Army Chief General Asim Munir's 'won't forget it' warning on Jammu and Kashmir drew a sharp reaction from India, with New Delhi urging Pakistan to hand over the 'illegally occupied territories,' referring to Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir.

No waqf appointments, changes to waqf by user till next hearing: Supreme CourtThe Centre assured the Supreme Court that no appointments would be made to Waqf boards. The new law makes it compulsory to include non-Muslims as its members.

BluSmart was a whiff of fresh air, but cleantech dirt choked itFor customers left at the mercy of last-minute ride cancellations and whimsical drivers, BluSmart was a breath of fresh air. Its courteous drivers with squeaky-clean EVs will be missed as BluSmart, ironically, falls victim to the dirt of cleantech. It has become another lesson to the Byjus chapter.

RCB sues Uber over viral 'Hyderabaddie' ad featuring Travis HeadRCB, in its petition before the Delhi High Court, alleged that Uber disparaged its trademark in its YouTube ad, 'Baddies in Bengaluru ft. Travis Head'.

Graham Staines murder convict walks free after 25 years; good day, says VHPMahendra Hembram, one of the convicts in the 1999-murder of Australian missionary Graham Staines and his two minor sons, walked free after spending 25 years behind bars. Hembram's release from jail, granted on grounds of good behaviour, was welcomed by the Vishwa Hindu Parishad.

ED probes Bengaluru breeder who bought Rs 50 crore wolfdogThe ED has launched a probe into Bengaluru's S Satish after his claim of buying a Rs 50 crore wolfdog went viral. He now says he only posed with the dog for photos.

High Court orders case against Tamil Nadu Minister over vulgar joke on HindusThe Madras High Court directed the police to file an FIR against Tamil Nadu Minister K Ponmudi for allegedly making vulgar remarks targeting Saivites, Vaishnavites and women. The court warned suo motu action if its directive was ignored.

Caste, cinema and uncomfortable truths: Phule's delayed release journey explainedWhy has a film about India's two revolutionary thinkers upset the self-proclaimed caretakers of the Brahmin community? Did the caste-discrimination that Savitribai Phule and Jyotiba Phule fought against not exist in India? Is the country free from caste-based prejudices today?

Mumbai Metro gets mega tunnel breakthrough, route to cut travel time by 60 minsMetro Line 7A is a 3.4-kilometre extension of the existing Line 7, which runs from Dahisar East to Gundavli. The extension will connect the city's metro network to the Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport (CSMI).

Hyderabad pet owner kills newborn pups by smashing them against wallA Hyderabad businessman and pet owner killed five newborn stray puppies by smashing them against the floor and wall in the basement of an apartment. The inhumane act was caught on camera.

21 acres for just 99 paise: Big land allotment to TCS as Andhra bets big on techThe cabinet of Andhra Pradesh cleared the proposal on Tuesday, stating that the project is expected to bring in an investment of around Rs 1,370 crore and create nearly 12,000 jobs.

Elon Musk reaches out to women to have babies, wants to build a 'legion': ReportElon Musk, the world's richest man, has offered his sperm to women, used surrogates, and worked secret deals with women to keep his personal affairs out of public view, according to a WSJ report.

BCCI penalises Delhi Capitals bowling coach Munaf Patel. Here's whyIPL 2025: Delhi Capitals bowling coach Munaf Patel was seen arguing with the fourth umpire from near the boundary rope during the team's thrilling win over Rajasthan Royals on Wednesday, April 16.

BJP's Dilip Ghosh asks Hindus in Bengal to keep weapons amid Waqf violenceThree people died and several were injured as Bengal's Murshidabad and South 24 Parganas districts witnessed widespread violence during protests over the passage of the Waqf law.

Deserves to shut down: Court slams DPS Dwarka for confining students over feesDelhi High Court remarked that DPS, Dwarka, appeared to be functioning as a "money-making machine" rather than an educational institution. Calling the treatment of students a form of "torture", the judge suggested that the principal could face criminal prosecution.

YouTuber claims 'fake paneer served' at Gauri Khan's Torii, restaurant reactsA popular YouTuber alleged the use of fake paneer at Gauri Khan's high-end restaurant, Torii. The establishment addressed the claims and issued a response.

We're Hindus, not Hindi: Raj Thackeray on third language mandate in schoolsMaharashtra Navnirman Sena chief Raj Thackeray opposed the state government's decision to implement the National Education Policy (NEP) 2020, introducing Hindi as a mandatory third language from the academic year 2025–26.

BJP slams Tamil Nadu government for using temple logo on Karunanidhi's memorialA replica of a temple structure, similar to that of Srivilliputhur kovil tower, atop M Karunanidhi's memorial has triggered a political row in Tamil Nadu. The BJP accused the ruling DMK of insulting Hindu sentiments.

Looking for a scooter under Rs 1 lakh? From Activa to Access, here are 5 optionsThe two-wheeler segment growth in FY25 was led by the scooters due to improved rural and semi-urban connectivity and the availability of new models with enhanced features.

Hypatia of Alexandria: Earliest female mathematician, lynched by a religious mobBack in 5th-century Alexandria, Hypatia stood as a symbol of knowledge. She is the earliest-known female philosopher and mathematician who challenged rising religious extremism. Her intellect and influence threatened powerful men at a time when the rise of Christianity wanted fewer questions, especially from women. She taught men how to think -- and a Christian mob killed her for it.

Supreme Court allows Bengal to retain 'untainted' teachers till fresh selectionThe Supreme Court allowed the West Bengal government to continue the employment of 'untainted' assistant teachers for classes 9-12. The teachers' jobs were terminated earlier this month due to irregularities in the selection process.

Flipkart ends WFH policy, asks all employees to work from office: ReportFlipkart had initially offered flexibility to employees during the pandemic. But over the past year, the company began rolling back the policy in phases—first calling senior executives back to office. Now, the mandate applies to all employees, regardless of role or function.

First Indian-origin woman elected President of UK's Royal College of PhysiciansMumtaz Patel became the first British-Indian woman to be elected the President of the Royal College of Physicians (RCP). She will be just the fourth woman head in the RCP's 500-year history. The Indo-British Muslim doctor was awarded the Outstanding Leader Award last year.

sports.headline: Golf: PGA Tour suspends Wesley Bryan over LIV-backed eventGolf star Wesley Bryan was suspended from the PGA Tour for participating in 'The Duels: Miami,' a LIV Golf-backed creator event.

Since coming to PBKS, been feeling like a senior in team: Arshdeep SinghPBKS pacer Arshdeep Singh has said that apart from his first season at the franchise, he has felt like a senior in the squad. Arshdeep has been leading Punjab's attack since joining the team in 2019.

Santiago Bernabeu jeers at Kylian Mbappe: The Frenchman's numbers roar backKylian Mbappe's Champions League night ended in heartbreak as Arsenal dismantled Real Madrid and a section of the Bernabeu jeered their star. But football is rarely a solo show — and Mbappe can't carry the crown alone.

Teenage shooter Suruchi Singh leads India's medal rush in Peru World Cup ISSF World Cup 2025: A day after winning the 10m air pistol gold medal, Suruchi Singh, an 18-year-old from Haryana, combined with Saurabh Chaudhary to win the 10m air pistol mixed team in Lima.

NBA: Sacramento Kings part ways with GM Monte McNair following Play-In loss to MavericksThe Sacramento Kings have officially parted ways with general manager Monte McNair. This decision comes just hours after the team's 120-106 loss to the Dallas Mavericks in the NBA Play-in tournament.

Ishan Kishan not fixated on SRH's 300-run dreamDespite Sunrisers Hyderabad's open ambition to breach the 300-run barrier, Ishan Kishan insists there's no obsession with the number. For him, the priority remains team performance over milestones or individual landmarks.

Abhishek Nayar made scapegoat? Sacking of India assistant coach shocks fansThe sacking of Abhishek Nayar, India's assistant coach, just eight months into his tenure has not gone down well with a section of fans. The former Mumbai all-rounder has become the first casualty of the BCCI's review meeting following India's disastrous Test tour of Australia.

Axar Patel relishing DC captaincy in IPL 2025: I don't go by the templateDelhi Capitals captain Axar Patel is enjoying his captaincy, especially after leading his side to the top of the IPL 2025 points table following a thrilling Super Over victory over Rajasthan Royals at the Arun Jaitley Stadium.

BCCI penalises Delhi Capitals bowling coach Munaf Patel. Here's whyIPL 2025: Delhi Capitals bowling coach Munaf Patel was seen arguing with the fourth umpire from near the boundary rope during the team's thrilling win over Rajasthan Royals on Wednesday, April 16.

MLB Dodgers vs Rockies: Treasure performs, Tommy Edman shares unforgettable momentKorean pride and baseball passion came together at Dodger Stadium during the Los Angeles Dodgers' 8-7 win over the Colorado Rockies on Wednesday night, April 16. South Korean boy band Treasure ignited the crowd at Centerfield Plaza.

Watch: MS Dhoni stops to take selfie with fan in wheelchair amid airport securityIPL2025: Chennai Super Kings captain MS Dhoni took time out to meet and greet a fan in a wheelchair while heading out of an airport. Dhoni's heartwarming gesture has been appreciated on social media.

Abhishek Nayar made scapegoat? Sacking of India assistant coach shocks fansThe sacking of Abhishek Nayar, India's assistant coach, just eight months into his tenure has not gone down well with a section of fans. The former Mumbai all-rounder has become the first casualty of the BCCI's review meeting following India's disastrous Test tour of Australia.

Axar Patel relishing DC captaincy in IPL 2025: I don't go by the templateDelhi Capitals captain Axar Patel is enjoying his captaincy, especially after leading his side to the top of the IPL 2025 points table following a thrilling Super Over victory over Rajasthan Royals at the Arun Jaitley Stadium.

BCCI penalises Delhi Capitals bowling coach Munaf Patel. Here's whyIPL 2025: Delhi Capitals bowling coach Munaf Patel was seen arguing with the fourth umpire from near the boundary rope during the team's thrilling win over Rajasthan Royals on Wednesday, April 16.

MLB Dodgers vs Rockies: Treasure performs, Tommy Edman shares unforgettable momentKorean pride and baseball passion came together at Dodger Stadium during the Los Angeles Dodgers' 8-7 win over the Colorado Rockies on Wednesday night, April 16. South Korean boy band Treasure ignited the crowd at Centerfield Plaza.

Watch: MS Dhoni stops to take selfie with fan in wheelchair amid airport securityIPL2025: Chennai Super Kings captain MS Dhoni took time out to meet and greet a fan in a wheelchair while heading out of an airport. Dhoni's heartwarming gesture has been appreciated on social media.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
